summary: The Fair Investment Opportunities for Professional Experts Act (H.R. 3394) aims to amend the Securities Act of 1933 by modifying the definition of an "accredited investor." The bill expands the criteria for individuals to qualify, including income and net worth thresholds, and allows for professional qualifications to be considered. It also mandates the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to update Regulation D to align with these changes.
